terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a vendor and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, ensuring teams work with the most current information
The process of creating, organizing, storing, and maintaining documents in a systematic way to ensure easy access and updates
The use of software to automatically execute business processes and tasks without manual intervention
A unified system where all documents and information are stored in one accessible location rather than scattered across multiple platforms
Security measures that determine who can view, edit, or manage specific documents or system resources
The ability to quickly locate and access specific documents using search functionality within a documentation system
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to industry regulations, standards, and legal requirements
Immediate synchronization of changes across all users and systems as soon as modifications are made to documents
The process of distributing information, skills, and expertise among team members or departments within an organization
Settings that control what actions different users can perform on documents, such as read-only, edit, or admin access
Technical documents that record manufacturing processes, quality control procedures, and operational guidelines for production teams
The ability to deliver products or services with minimal waste of time, resources, and effort while maintaining quality standards
The improper handling, organization, or maintenance of documents that leads to inefficiencies, errors, or compliance issues
